channel.title: Projects on Hugh's Curriculum Vitae
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Hugh's Curriculum Vitae

item.title: Automatic Speech Recognition
item.description: Working with several collaborators on Automatic Speech Recognition for low-resource tone languages.

item.title: Business Maturity Canvas
item.description: Discussing the business maturity of an ongoing business idea and a business in operation is a frequent task of IDX. This canvas was designed to facilitate that conversation.

item.title: R-90
item.description: Working within SIL’s Ideation and Experimentation Lab to produce a product which gives real time language use and valuation metrics.

item.title: Legal frameworks in language research
item.description: What legal framworks need to be considered when working with language data from a given community?

item.title: U̠t-Ma'in Lexicography
item.description: A collaboration with Becky Paterson to organize the various layers of U̠t-Ma’in linguistic data into a shareable resource.

item.title: U̠t-Ma'in oral history
item.description: U̠t-Ma’in Language Documentation with Becky Paterson.

item.title: Legal issues in linguistics
item.description: Clarifying what ‘rights holders’ have.

item.title: Wasta Linux additions for the language scientist.
item.description: Some changes and additions to Wasta Linux for the language and linguistic Scientist. It is basically a long bash script, and some additional settings.

item.title: An Awesome list of Software for Endangered Languages
item.description: A Github collaboration to index open source software for minority or low resource languages.

item.title: Linguistic Services Planning
item.description: We use the Business Model Canvas to develop the business case for SIL service offerings.

item.title: SIL Communications Strategy Consulting
item.description: An ongoing consultation with SIL staff to develop interdepartmental communications strategy.

item.title: The minority language typing experience
item.description: How much work is it to type languages with tonal markers in their orthographies?

item.title: User Experience Consulting on SIL.org
item.description: Worked with a team to bring modern features via Drupal 7 to the flagship website of SIL International.

item.title: Meꞌphaa and Sochiapam Chinantec Keyboards
item.description: Revolutionizing text input. We moved text input from being on a single OS via a non-unicode input method, to working on multiple OSes in Unicode.

item.title: Audio Digitization
item.description: SIL Americas Area project to digitize analogue audio mediums.

item.title: Photo Digitization
item.description: SIL Americas Area project to digitize photos documenting the people and the work of SIL in the Americas.

item.title: Text Digitization
item.description: SIL Americas Area project to digitize for electronic distribution many of its indigenous language resources in print mediums.

item.title: Language Archive Usability
item.description: This project seeks to make known issues in Language Resource Accessibility. It is primarily concerned with two facets of accessibility 1) the User Experience related to interacting with archived content; and 2) the aggregation of item level metadata about language resources in collections.

item.title: Geo-Linguistics
item.description: This project seeks to visually display patterns about languages as those visualizations relate to cartography.

item.title: Meꞌphaa Language Documentation
item.description: A collaboration with an experienced linguist. I contributed extensive metadata and technical audio-visual expertise a team of people from the USA and Meꞌphaa speakers.

item.title: Interdental approximant
item.description: An investigation and description of a rare and socially stigmatized speech sound where the tongue protrudes out of the mouth.
